scenarioDescription:
The TOI-564 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TOI-564 is a star with 1 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.09 times its radius. It is located 650.95 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 7.3 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TOI-564 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TOI-564 system


TOI-564 b

TOI-564 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2020-11, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TOI-564 b is 465.234 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TOI-564 b is 11.433 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TOI-564 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TOI-564, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TOI-564 - System With 1 Exoplanet
